meanings.sent1: My sib and I like to play together.
meanings.sent2: I have one sib, a younger sister.
meanings.sent3: At the park, my sib and I raced to the swings.
meanings.sent4: Growing up, my sib was my partner in crime.
meanings.sent5: The bond between sibs is special and enduring.

meanings.sent1: She is my only sib, but we are very close.
meanings.sent2: My sib and I share a room at home.
meanings.sent3: During the holidays, my sib and I bake cookies together.
meanings.sent4: In times of need, a sib can be your greatest support.
meanings.sent5: Having a sib means always having a friend by your side.

meanings.sent1: We are part of the same sib family.
meanings.sent2: The sib connection between us is strong.
meanings.sent3: The family reunion brought together all sib relatives.
meanings.sent4: Our sib ties bind us together no matter what.
meanings.sent5: The sib bond is unbreakable, no matter the distance.
